metadata._comment: User Custom Configuration - Static Isotropic Mode
metadata.description: Custom static isotropic configuration for user experiments
metadata.based_on: He et al. PNAS 2024 - Transport coefficient approach (static case)

analyzer_parameters._comment: Analysis parameters customized for user's experiment

temporal._dt_note: Time step between frames in seconds

geometry._gap_note: Gap in Angstroms (modify as needed for your setup)

optimization_config._comment: Optimization settings for user's static isotropic analysis

angle_filtering._isotropic_note: Disabled for isotropic analysis - user can enable if needed

classical_optimization._methods_note: Classical methods: Nelder-Mead (always available), Gurobi (if licensed). Robust methods are in separate robust_optimization section.

_usage_flags.--method classical: Runs all methods above in sequence, selects best result
_usage_flags.--method robust: Runs ONLY the three Robust-* methods for noise resistance
_usage_flags.--method all: Runs classical (including robust) + MCMC for complete analysis

classical_optimization._gurobi_availability: Gurobi quadratic programming solver provides an alternative to Nelder-Mead using quadratic approximation of the chi-squared objective function. Requires Gurobi license and installation (pip install gurobipy).
classical_optimization._robust_availability: Robust optimization methods require CVXPY (pip install cvxpy). Provides measurement noise resistance. Options: Robust-Wasserstein, Robust-Scenario, Robust-Ellipsoidal
classical_optimization._robust_flag_note: NEW: Use --method robust to run ONLY robust methods for dedicated noise-resistant estimation

Nelder-Mead._maxiter_note: Increased iterations for better convergence with 3 parameters
Nelder-Mead._xatol_note: Tighter parameter tolerance for high precision
Nelder-Mead._fatol_note: Tighter function tolerance for better fitting
Nelder-Mead._adaptive_note: Adaptive step sizes for better convergence

Gurobi._comment: ENHANCED: Now uses iterative Trust Region SQP instead of single-shot QP (fixes χ² convergence)
Gurobi._algorithm: Iterative trust region SQP optimization with quadratic approximation and adaptive radius
Gurobi._max_iterations_note: Fewer iterations needed for 3-parameter isotropic case
Gurobi._method_note: Gurobi solution method (2=barrier method recommended for QP)
Gurobi._time_limit_note: Shorter time limit for simple 3-parameter problem
Gurobi._usage_note: Gurobi uses quadratic approximation via finite differences. Best for smooth objective functions with bounds constraints.
Gurobi._advantages: Handles bounds constraints naturally, can be faster for well-conditioned problems
Gurobi._disadvantages: Requires license, uses quadratic approximation which may not capture all nonlinearity

_trust_region_settings._note: Trust region hyperparameters for enhanced optimization

classical_optimization._selection_strategy_note: How to choose best result when multiple methods are used: best_chi_squared, consensus, first_success

robust_optimization._comment: Robust optimization settings using CVXPY with optimized performance (CLARABEL/SCS solvers)
_usage_examples: python run_homodyne.py --method robust  # NEW: Run only robust methods
python run_homodyne.py --method robust --static-isotropic  # Robust in static mode
python run_homodyne.py --method classical  # Run all methods including robust
robust_optimization._robust_flag_benefits: NEW --method robust flag runs ONLY robust methods for dedicated noise-resistant estimation
robust_optimization._optimization_performance_note: v0.6.5+ optimizations: 100x-5000x speedup with caching, adaptive Jacobians, and streamlined solvers
robust_optimization._enabled_note: Set to false to disable robust optimization methods
robust_optimization._uncertainty_model_note: Primary method: wasserstein (DRO), scenario (bootstrap), ellipsoidal (bounded uncertainty)
robust_optimization._uncertainty_radius_note: Aggressive 0.5% for testing - minimal uncertainty to allow better fit
robust_optimization._n_scenarios_note: Increased to 20 for better uncertainty capture while maintaining performance
robust_optimization._regularization_alpha_note: Very low 0.001 for minimal smoothing - testing aggressive settings
robust_optimization._regularization_beta_note: Very low 0.0001 for maximum parameter freedom
robust_optimization._jacobian_epsilon_note: Finite difference epsilon for Jacobian computation
robust_optimization._enable_caching_note: Enable performance caching for repeated computations
robust_optimization._enable_progressive_note: Disabled for direct optimization - may achieve better fit
robust_optimization._preferred_solver_note: Preferred CVXPY solver: CLARABEL, SCS, CVXOPT

solver_settings._comment: Gurobi solver configuration optimized for XPCS problems
solver_settings._Method_note: Barrier method (2) recommended for robust QP/SOCP problems
solver_settings._CrossOver_note: Skip crossover for numerical stability with experimental data
solver_settings._BarHomogeneous_note: Use homogeneous barrier method for better convergence
solver_settings._TimeLimit_note: Increased to 600s for better convergence quality
solver_settings._MIPGap_note: Tightened to 1e-6 for better fit quality
solver_settings._NumericFocus_note: Reduced to 1 for better accuracy vs speed balance
solver_settings._OutputFlag_note: Silent mode - change to 1 for debug output

method_options._comment: Method-specific parameters for different robust optimization approaches

wasserstein._description: Distributionally Robust Optimization with Wasserstein uncertainty sets
wasserstein._uncertainty_radius_note: Very aggressive 0.3% for Wasserstein - testing minimal uncertainty
wasserstein._advantages: Theoretical guarantees, handles measurement noise well, smooth convergence
wasserstein._best_for: Noisy experimental data, when measurement uncertainty is well-characterized

scenario._description: Scenario-based robust optimization using bootstrap resampling
scenario._n_scenarios_note: Optimized to 25 scenarios for better uncertainty capture
scenario._advantages: Outlier resistance, computationally intuitive, handles model misspecification
scenario._best_for: Data with outliers, when correlation function model may be approximate

ellipsoidal._description: Ellipsoidal uncertainty sets for bounded data uncertainty
ellipsoidal._gamma_note: Reduced to 2% for tighter uncertainty bounds and better fit
ellipsoidal._advantages: Bounded uncertainty, efficient computation, parameter sparsity control
ellipsoidal._best_for: Well-characterized noise levels, when uncertainty bounds are known

robust_optimization._first_run_recommendation: Start with wasserstein method for theoretical guarantees and smooth convergence
robust_optimization._runtime_performance_note: Robust methods typically 2-5x slower than classical but provide uncertainty resistance
robust_optimization._requirements: Requires CVXPY (pip install cvxpy). Gurobi license recommended for best performance.

_robust_only_recommendations.when_to_use_robust_flag: Use --method robust when you specifically want noise-resistant estimation without classical methods

optimal_settings_for_robust_only.uncertainty_radius: 0.05-0.08 for noisy data, 0.03 for clean data
optimal_settings_for_robust_only.n_scenarios: 30-50 for balanced performance, increase for higher precision

_robust_only_recommendations.expected_output: Results saved to /robust/ directory with method-specific plots
_robust_only_recommendations.comparison_strategy: All three robust methods run, best chi-squared selected automatically

mcmc_sampling._draws_note: Fewer draws needed with only 3 parameters
mcmc_sampling._thin_note: Moderate thinning for static mode (good convergence expected)

scaling_parameters._comment: Physical scaling for c2_fitted = c2_theory * contrast + offset

analysis_settings._static_mode_note: True for static analysis (only D0, alpha, D_offset)

chi_squared_calculation._scaling_note: Scaling optimization always enabled for proper chi-squared

performance_settings._comment: Performance settings optimized for user's system

noise_model._note: False uses full forward model consistent with classical optimization

validation_rules._comment: Data validation and quality control for user analysis

output_settings._output_structure: homodyne_analysis_results.json (main summary) saved to output directory root. Method-specific results saved to individual directories: classical/[method_name]/ and robust/[method_name]/ containing analysis_results_[method_name].json, parameters.json, fitted_data.npz (consolidated: c2_experimental, c2_fitted, residuals, parameters, uncertainties, chi_squared, phi_angles, t1, t2), and c2_heatmaps_[method_name].png. Summary files: all_classical_methods_summary.json and all_robust_methods_summary.json. MCMC: results saved to mcmc/ subdirectory with same fitted_data.npz structure.

c2_heatmaps._method_specific_note: When multiple optimization methods are used (e.g., Nelder-Mead + Gurobi), separate heatmaps are generated for each method with method names in filenames

output._filename_template_note: Frame-aware plotting: includes start_frame, end_frame for data range identification, method name (e.g., Nelder-Mead, Gurobi), and timestamp
